reviewText: As much as I despised Eazy-E, what he stood for, and the downward direction he and NWA took rap music, I gave him credit for one thing, discovering the BONE THUGS family. I've always liked their singsongy, melodic, storytellig style of rap.Not only does this include their good stuff like RESURRECTION, CROSS ROADS, and others, it also has some videos from their companions, the MO THUGS family, which added female vocal harmony support from Thug Queen and Felicia. The likeable and amusing GHETTO COWBOY is included (with harmonica support from Bobby Z), picture Dodge City meeting the hood and you get the idea.The DVD also includes I consider to be one of the most beautiful hip hop tunes and videos ever made, THUG DEVOTION. Don't let the title fool you, this is a truly wonderful, positive, and uplifting piece based on EW&F;'s DEVOTION and celebrates the unity among the group members and decries violence. Sort of a younger cousin to De La Soul's BUDDY .Too bad more rap isn't like this at the moment, see how great the genre could be and pick this up.
summary: Great stuff from the Thug Families

reviewText: Since I have most of Roy's DVD I was influenced by some reviewers'remarks about the special features. The first part of this CD areexcerpts from other well known DVD so there's nothing new. The only"novelty" is Roy's "Walk On" from 1968. The interesting thing, indeed,is part two where they show us the making of "King of Hearts" and"I Drove All Night" + the musical videos "She's A Mistery To Me" and"Crying". Besides a lot of details presented by his wife Barbara.It also holds a song never heard before which was recorded in 1957 andfinally the difference between hearing "Crying" in MONO and STEREO duringRoy's famous concert in Holland.

reviewText: This special takes 13 Roy Orbison hits, and all these are live pefromances from concerts and live appearances including Roy Orbison and Freinds, a Black and White Night, and Roy Orbison live at Austin City Limits. The specials features are 2 musical videos, when where Roy Orbison does a deut with k.d. lang on Crying, and She's a Mystery to Me. And there have special appprances frpm Bruce Springsteen, Elvis Costello, Jackson Browne, Tom Wait, Bonnie Raitt, Jennifer Warnes, k.d. lang, and T Bone Bournett, all from the Black and White Night concert. The songs are1. Go, Go, Go, (Down the Line)2. In Dreams3. Blue Bayou4. Ooby Dooby5. Only the Lonely6. It's Over7. Claudette8. That Lovin' You Feelin' Again9. You Got It10. Crying11. Walk on12. Running Scared13. Oh, Pretty WomanWhat I like about this, they have the program on dvd, and cd both together, so that you can listen to it, if you don't feel like watching it, or you can watch it if you don't feel like listening to it. I haven't really see the specials features, but in bewtween songs (or most of them) Roy Orbison talks, a gives you a little history about his carrier, and the songs that he pefromances. I might have swpet Walk on for Candy Man. You Got iIt was recored, and played on his final cd "Mystery Girl" that was released in 1989, after his death. It was too bad that he died when he did, but he had a great carrier, and there are plenty of songs, and dvds that his fans can rememeber him by.
summary: The greatest hits of Roy Orbison!
